address: Xã Tân Hoà, Huyện Buôn Đôn, Tỉnh Đắk Lắk
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Address Change**

Okay, so I've got this old address: "Xã Tân Hoà, Huyện Buôn Đôn, Tỉnh Đắk Lắk". My goal is to determine the new administrative unit.

First, I broke down the address: "Xã Tân Hoà" (Ward), "Huyện Buôn Đôn" (District), and "Tỉnh Đắk Lắk" (Province). I know that Đắk Lắk is still a valid province, so that's good.

Now, I'm diving into the resolutions, specifically looking at the ones related to administrative changes. My target is resolution "1660/NQ-UBTVQH15", which deals with restructuring wards in Đắk Lắk.

I scanned through the lines and, bingo, line 6 caught my eye: it mentions merging "Tân Hòa" with "Ea Huar" and "Ea Wer" to create "Xã Ea Wer". The tricky part is, the resolution doesn't explicitly state the district for this "Tân Hòa". I have to be careful here, given my original address.

Line 7 and 84 weren't relevant, since they didn't specifically reference the district I was concerned about. Line 96 also had no bearing on my research.

After re-reading the text, I'm reasonably confident. While the resolution is unclear on the district, the most logical conclusion, given the original address, is that the "Tân Hòa" in line 6 is the one I'm looking for. So, the new ward is "Xã Ea Wer".

Just to be sure, I cross-referenced this with the "New wards" list, looking for "Xã Ea Wer" in Đắk Lắk. And there it is: `{"ward_code":"24241","ward_name":"Xã Ea Wer","province_name":"Tỉnh Đắk Lắk"}`. It's a perfect match! That confirms it. I have the new administrative unit.

citation.header: 1660/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Đắk Lắk
citation.line: 6. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Ea Huar, Tân Hòa và Ea Wer thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Ea Wer.
